trans-unit.source: This rule measures class coupling by counting the number of unique type references that a symbol contains. Symbols that have a high degree of class coupling can be difficult to maintain. It is a good practice to have types and methods that exhibit low coupling and high cohesion. To fix this violation, try to redesign the code to reduce the number of types to which it is coupled.
trans-unit.target: This rule measures class coupling by counting the number of unique type references that a symbol contains. Symbols that have a high degree of class coupling can be difficult to maintain. It is a good practice to have types and methods that exhibit low coupling and high cohesion. To fix this violation, try to redesign the code to reduce the number of types to which it is coupled.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' is coupled with '{1}' different types from '{2}' different namespaces. Rewrite or refactor the code to decrease its class coupling below '{3}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' is coupled with '{1}' different types from '{2}' different namespaces. Rewrite or refactor the code to decrease its class coupling below '{3}'.

trans-unit.source: Avoid excessive class coupling
trans-unit.target: Avoid excessive class coupling

trans-unit.source:
Cyclomatic complexity measures the number of linearly independent paths through the method, which is determined by the number and complexity of conditional branches. A low cyclomatic complexity generally indicates a method that is easy to understand, test, and maintain. The cyclomatic complexity is calculated from a control flow graph of the method and is given as follows:
cyclomatic complexity = the number of edges - the number of nodes + 1
where a node represents a logic branch point and an edge represents a line between nodes.
trans-unit.target:
Cyclomatic complexity measures the number of linearly independent paths through the method, which is determined by the number and complexity of conditional branches. A low cyclomatic complexity generally indicates a method that is easy to understand, test, and maintain. The cyclomatic complexity is calculated from a control flow graph of the method and is given as follows:
cyclomatic complexity = the number of edges - the number of nodes + 1
where a node represents a logic branch point and an edge represents a line between nodes.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' has a cyclomatic complexity of '{1}'. Rewrite or refactor the code to decrease its complexity below '{2}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' has a cyclomatic complexity of '{1}'. Rewrite or refactor the code to decrease its complexity below '{2}'.

trans-unit.source: Avoid excessive complexity
trans-unit.target: Avoid excessive complexity

trans-unit.source: Deeply nested type hierarchies can be difficult to follow, understand, and maintain. This rule limits analysis to hierarchies in the same module. To fix a violation of this rule, derive the type from a base type that is less deep in the inheritance hierarchy or eliminate some of the intermediate base types.
trans-unit.target: Deeply nested type hierarchies can be difficult to follow, understand, and maintain. This rule limits analysis to hierarchies in the same module. To fix a violation of this rule, derive the type from a base type that is less deep in the inheritance hierarchy or eliminate some of the intermediate base types.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' has an object hierarchy '{1}' levels deep within the defining module. If possible, eliminate base classes within the hierarchy to decrease its hierarchy level below '{2}': '{3}'
trans-unit.target: '{0}' has an object hierarchy '{1}' levels deep within the defining module. If possible, eliminate base classes within the hierarchy to decrease its hierarchy level below '{2}': '{3}'

trans-unit.source: Avoid excessive inheritance
trans-unit.target: Avoid excessive inheritance

trans-unit.source: The maintainability index is calculated by using the following metrics: lines of code, program volume, and cyclomatic complexity. Program volume is a measure of the difficulty of understanding of a symbol that is based on the number of operators and operands in the code. Cyclomatic complexity is a measure of the structural complexity of the type or method. A low maintainability index indicates that code is probably difficult to maintain and would be a good candidate to redesign.
trans-unit.target: The maintainability index is calculated by using the following metrics: lines of code, program volume, and cyclomatic complexity. Program volume is a measure of the difficulty of understanding of a symbol that is based on the number of operators and operands in the code. Cyclomatic complexity is a measure of the structural complexity of the type or method. A low maintainability index indicates that code is probably difficult to maintain and would be a good candidate to redesign.

trans-unit.source: '{0}' has a maintainability index of '{1}'. Rewrite or refactor the code to increase its maintainability index (MI) above '{2}'.
trans-unit.target: '{0}' has a maintainability index of '{1}'. Rewrite or refactor the code to increase its maintainability index (MI) above '{2}'.

trans-unit.source: Avoid unmaintainable code
trans-unit.target: Avoid unmaintainable code

trans-unit.source: Invalid entry in code metrics rule specification file
trans-unit.target: Invalid entry in code metrics rule specification file

trans-unit.source: Invalid entry '{0}' in code metrics rule specification file '{1}'
trans-unit.target: Invalid entry '{0}' in code metrics rule specification file '{1}'

trans-unit.source: Invalid entry in code metrics rule specification file
trans-unit.target: Invalid entry in code metrics rule specification file

trans-unit.source: Variable names should not match field names
trans-unit.target: 变量名不应与字段名相同

trans-unit.source: An instance method declares a parameter or a local variable whose name matches an instance field of the declaring type, leading to errors.
trans-unit.target: 实例方法声明参数或局部变量，该参数或变量的名称与声明类型的实例字段匹配，从而导致错误。

trans-unit.source: {0}, a variable declared in {1}, has the same name as an instance field on the type. Change the name of one of these items.
trans-unit.target: {0} ({1} 中声明的变量)与该类型的某一实例字段同名。请更改其中一项的名称。

trans-unit.source: {0}, a parameter declared in {1}, has the same name as an instance field on the type. Change the name of one of these items.
trans-unit.target: {0} ({1} 中声明的参数)与该类型的某一实例字段同名。请更改其中一项的名称。

trans-unit.source: Review unused parameters
trans-unit.target: 检查未使用的参数

trans-unit.source: A method signature includes a parameter that is not used in the method body.
trans-unit.target: 方法签名包括一个未在方法体中使用的参数。

trans-unit.source: Parameter {0} of method {1} is never used. Remove the parameter or use it in the method body.
trans-unit.target: 从未用过方法 {1} 的参数 {0}。请删除该参数或在方法体中使用它。

trans-unit.source: Remove unused parameter
trans-unit.target: 删除未使用的参数

trans-unit.source: Do not ignore method results
trans-unit.target: 不要忽略方法结果

trans-unit.source: A new object is created but never used; or a method that creates and returns a new string is called and the new string is never used; or a COM or P/Invoke method returns an HRESULT or error code that is never used.
trans-unit.target: 已创建新对象，但未使用过该对象；或已调用创建并返回新字符串的方法，但未使用过该新字符串；或 COM 或 P/Invoke 方法返回从未使用过的 HRESULT 或错误代码。

trans-unit.source: {0} creates a new instance of {1} which is never used. Pass the instance as an argument to another method, assign the instance to a variable, or remove the object creation if it is unnecessary.
trans-unit.target: {0} 创建 {1} 的新实例，但该实例从未使用过。如果不需要此实例，请将它作为参数传递给另一个方法，将此实例赋给变量或删除对象创建。

trans-unit.source: {0} calls {1} but does not use the new string instance that the method returns. Pass the instance as an argument to another method, assign the instance to a variable, or remove the call if it is unnecessary.
trans-unit.target: {0} 调用 {1}，但不使用该方法返回的新字符串实例。如果不需要此实例，请将它作为参数传递给另一个方法，将此实例赋给变量或删除调用。

trans-unit.source: {0} calls {1} but does not use the HRESULT or error code that the method returns. This could lead to unexpected behavior in error conditions or low-resource situations. Use the result in a conditional statement, assign the result to a variable, or pass it as an argument to another method.
trans-unit.target: {0} 调用 {1}，但不使用该方法返回的 HRESULT 或错误代码。这可能会导致在出错或资源较少的情况下出现意外行为。请使用条件语句中的结果，并将结果赋给变量或将其作为自变量传递给另一个方法。

trans-unit.source: {0} calls {1} but does not explicitly check whether the conversion succeeded. Either use the return value in a conditional statement or verify that the call site expects that the out argument will be set to the default value when the conversion fails.
trans-unit.target: {0} 调用 {1}，但不显式检查转换是否成功。请使用条件语句中的返回值，或验证在转换失败时调用站点是否希望将 out 参数设置为默认值。

trans-unit.source: Avoid uninstantiated internal classes
trans-unit.target: 避免未实例化的内部类

trans-unit.source: An instance of an assembly-level type is not created by code in the assembly.
trans-unit.target: 程序集级别类型的实例不由程序集中的代码创建。

trans-unit.source: {0} is an internal class that is apparently never instantiated. If so, remove the code from the assembly. If this class is intended to contain only static members, make it static (Shared in Visual Basic).
trans-unit.target: {0} 是显然从未实例化过的内部类。如果是这样，请从程序集中删除该代码。如果此内部类只用于包含静态成员，请使其成为静态类(在 Visual Basic 中为 Shared)。

trans-unit.source: Avoid unused private fields
trans-unit.target: 避免未使用的私有字段

trans-unit.source: Private fields were detected that do not appear to be accessed in the assembly.
trans-unit.target: 检测到程序集内似乎有未访问过的私有字段。

trans-unit.source: Unused field '{0}'.
trans-unit.target: 未使用的字段“{0}”。

trans-unit.source: {0} calls {1} but does not use the value the method returns. Because {1} is marked as a Pure method, it cannot have side effects. Use the result in a conditional statement, assign the result to a variable, or pass it as an argument to another method.
trans-unit.target: {0} 调用 {1}，但不使用方法返回的值。{1} 被标记为纯方法，所以不会有副作用。请使用条件语句中的结果，并将结果赋给变量或将其作为自变量传递给另一个方法。

trans-unit.source: Using nameof helps keep your code valid when refactoring.
trans-unit.target: 在重构时使用 nameof 帮助代码保持有效性。

trans-unit.source: Use nameof in place of string literal '{0}'
trans-unit.target: 使用 nameof 代替字符串文本“{0}”

trans-unit.source: Use nameof to express symbol names
trans-unit.target: 使用 nameof 表达符号名称
